Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Spankytoes
Reviews.Content: I am in the midst of a 4 night stay at this hotel. Check-in is quick and easy. Very friendly staff. Breakfast is overpriced at €13 per person. Rooms are larger than I expected. Small bathrooms and TV. Only 2 English channels, and one of them is CNN. Location is about a 1.5 minute walk from the Landsberger Allee S bahn stop with several trains and trams to connect you to the city. If you want to stay near the action, this is not the hotel for you. However, it's about 16 minutes tram ride to Alexanderplatz where you will find a myriad of things to do. There is a Mexican restaurant a few doors down and a few corner stores to buy beer and supplies next door. There is also a small shopping center with groceries, a pharmacy and an ice cream store around the corner. There is an EXCELLENT Italian place about a 5 minute walk away with a great value for portions. (The name escapes me, but ask the front desk) Burger King across the street for a late night snack. Free wifi, but you have to get a card every day as they change the username and password. This allows you 24 hours of Internet. Hotel is next to the Generator youth hostel, but I didn't notice an influx of teens. Safe neighborhood. If I had an unlimited budget, Park Plaza Alexanderplatz or the Radisson Blu would be my first Club Carlson choices. But since I needed 4 nights, and wanted to use points, this hotel made more sense. I feel that it was a great value for my needs. I wouldn't hesitate to,stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: dayfornight99
Reviews.Content: I found that I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Sure, the rooms could use new carpet and updated tv, but I liked the location. Close to public transportation and located in a simple shopping mall. Right down stairs from hotel, I had a food court/restaurants, grocery store, pharmacy, and many other types of small food shops. When visiting as a tourist, the proximity to all of these things is very important before you head out for the day. As noted in many other reviews this hotel won't be for everyone, but I really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: unkown2011
Reviews.Content: Booked a business room. Size much better than other experiences in berlin. Near to public transportations. Wifii free.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the location”
Reviews.Author: ewills79
Reviews.Content: This not the best of the Park Plaza hotels, but it is in a great location. The staff is friendly, polite, and very helpful. The tram, subway, and the train are both in very close walking distance. There are a lot of sightseeing places within a couple of stops of the hotel. The hotel was clean, but could use some updating. It was outdated and dingy looking.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ssk78
Reviews.Content: The internet was slow. The location isn't exactly the best either.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, good transportation, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Erinchhh
Reviews.Content: We have found this hotel via bidding site and at first we were a bit dissapointed since it was not near center of Berlin. But when we went to Berlin, we have discovered that transportation to the hotel is very easy, and there is tram from Alexanderplatz even at midnight. Hotel is quite clean and rooms are roomy, and the staff is very helpful when you ask something, even when we could not find a good bar, we came to hotel for a beer and the service was nice. Accross the avenue the hotel stands, there is also Burger King and there are some small cafes that you can get breakfast or meal. If your will stay at Berlin and don't want to spend much money, you can stay here easily and go to the city center via tram in 10 minutes or so, with a walk of 2 minutes to station at most.

Reviews.Title: “Best to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: Katergo
Reviews.Content: 3 good reasons not to book this hotel : - horrible sewage smell in the room. Was OK the 1st night, berable the second night ... the 3rd night one was feeling like throwing up when walking into the room. I asked to change room but was answered the hotel was full. OK but that did not solve my problem. - rooms are bland. Old fashion Ikea style furniture - the hotel is in a suburb in the middle of nowhere Berlin is a great city. Don't spoil your trip by staying at Park Plaza ! I just wonder how this hotel can advertise 4*. The stays must have fallen from the sky !

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a basic hotel but far from the core”
Reviews.Author: Alexander013
Reviews.Content: I went for business to Berlin for a week and I was given such a great rate for the room, too hard not to accept. The hotel was better than I expected but quite basic. No pool, no gym but the Wifi is for free!!! (FYI. Wifi is never free in Germany so this is very rare.) Location was not ideal for a tourist but since I rented a vehicle, it wasn't terrible. Even though I didn't use the public transport, it was a block away. All the tourist attractions are quite far away even with a vehicle but the area is quite OK with even a Burger King for those picky eaters.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no ventilation!”
Reviews.Author: roferg
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 5 days at the Park Plaza and overall were quite happy with the experience. The location is EXCELLENT - you can't get any closer to transit with an S-Bahn, U-Bahn, and tram stop right beside the building. The accessibility to transit made getting to the hotel from the Schonenberg airport a snap, and also made exploring the city by transit worry-free. The room was very clean and the toiletries provided were nice as well. Our only complaint was that the room was impossible to ventilate...the window opened only a crack, and the HVAC system didn't do anything. We ended up buying a cheap desk fan at Alexanderplatz on our first night and that made it bearable. Aside from the stuffiness, the room was great - we were facing the inner courtyard, so it was dead quiet. We'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Tourist Hotel, I'd happily use again”
Reviews.Author: Desmond S
Reviews.Content: Excellent as tourist base. Not a "top quality" hotel as has been stated in previous reviews but it's great value, it's clean, comfortable beds, helpful friendly staff and breakfast was very good. My wife is in a wheelchair and we had one of the larger rooms with the disabled bathroom - excellent. We didn't use the ground floor restaurant so can't comment on food or service. TV channel choices were predominently non-English but frankly on holiday I'm more interested in getting out and about than watching telly in a hotel room. A word of caution to those with young children - without any warning you can get more than an eyeful if you channel hop over the pay per view naughty channels. Best take control of the remote Tram stop and S-Bahn station (on Berlin ring) just around the corner in Landsberger Allee both with frequent services. Purchase a 1,2,3 or 5 day ABC travel ticket and your set for travel on S-Bahn, U-Bahn, Trams and Buses throughout the city and a fair bit beyond,. I'd have no hesitation in booking the Park Plaza on my next Berlin visit and can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: AlanSpavin
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest - if you're expecting top quality hotels and banquet meals via a £150 Groupon offer then you're probably going to be disappointed. The hotel is what it is - a suburban modern-ish square box with sub-Premier Inn fixtures and fittings. A quick look at tripadvisor and the area would tell you that. It's not four star - probably does well with coach parties and people playing at the sports complex next door - but it was never going to be more than a cheap and cheerful place to sleep. On the positive side - it's clean, good breakfast, friendly staff and actually pretty well-located - albeit in an area that looks like a main road into Liverpool. But then this was East Germany - and anyone reading a little bit of history of the city would marvel at the fact that people seem cheerful, resourceful and helpful after all the misery they've been through. Buy an ABC ticket at the airport and you have the run of every train/tram/underground for miles around for about £7 a day. The very regular tram round the corner drops you in the city in about 10 mins and two stops north on the S-Bahn - also two minutes walk - you're in Prenzlauer Berg. We passed on the Groupon grub - and headed to Prenzlauer Berg - lots of restaurants (would recommend Zum Dritten Mann on Kollwitzstrasse) open in the evening in a lovely area of cobbled streets and grand albeit yuppified houses. Very pleasant to wander around during the day as well with lots of coffee and cake shops. Overall - you get what you pay for - we were reasonably happy with the hotel. Would probably stay somewhere a little more centrally next time but Berlin's a fascinating city that repays repeat visits and if you want somewhere with great transport links (direct to the airport as well) then I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ok in a bland sort of a way. Certainly not 4 stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: markalroberts
Reviews.Content: So, initially a bit of a disappointment as we realised this wasn't a lot different to your average Travellodge in the UK. However, it was clean and functional and our rooms where made daily. Sometimes they didn't replace the teabags and I don't think they changed the sheets very often in the week we were there. It was a 45 minute walk to the centre of Berlin or a 20 minute tram ride. If you can find somewhere a bit more traditional in this city of 90s glass, then go for it, but if you want safe, then this will do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Great for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: CarshaltonDon
Reviews.Content: If like us, you just want a comfortable hotel room with a good bed. bathroom and breakfast and want to spend the day actually sightseeing instead of popping back to the room every 5 minutes or using the wifi, this is perfect. It does not take 20 minutes to get anywhere - the tram station is around the corner (10 minutes to Alexanderplatz) and so is the S-Bahn. The staff are friendly too. Great place - will stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - but could easily be improved”
Reviews.Author: Giles527
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel - but to be asked, when we asked where dinner was served, "oh, are you from Groupon?" - and then be told that we're going to be eating downstairs in the bar was disappointing. Surely, when Groupon say you're going to be getting something worth so much then you expect to be getting what full price customers are paying. No problem to be being a little out of town - the trams were brilliant and the main line station was just round the corner too. In the room was a kettle and one "normal" tea-bag and no coffee. This should be sorted out as it was a disappointment. In addition, the potato soup followed by potato and ham was disappointing as, again, we thought that was the Groupon menu but later found out that it was the same for all. All in all, rooms were clean and staff were very friendly - but don't expect a lively bar or good eating there - just go into the centre of Berlin for that. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, we would return again.”
Reviews.Author: paulacklam
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a Groupon deal. Found our way from airport by bus and then tram -very easy. The tram ride to the centre only took 7mins with very frequent trams running only few mins. apart. Staff extremely helpful, large room, comfortable bed and surprisingly quiet. Would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel or recommending ot tp others.

Reviews.Title: “Not so far away”
Reviews.Author: lacontessa1
Reviews.Content: We are ending our five night stay with another couple this weekend. From previous reviews, I was worried about how far away the hotel was, but, found the tram ride home from Alexanderplatz each night very easy (about 10 minutes). We bought a three day welcome card including the museum island, plus a group transportation ticket for our arrival day so that we could extend our transportation. The big sign for the Generator hostel next door made it easy to find out way from the train station when we arrived from southern Germany, as well as find our way home each night. It seems that any place you stay in Berlin, getting a public transportation pass makes a lot of sense since the sights are not that close together. We used Priceline name your own price--about $600 for two rooms for five nights (about 18 percent discount over the pre purchase price through the hotel website). The Priceline price, though, did not include breakfast which is 12 euros per person. it seems like most people who reserve here have breakfast included. We noted that restaurant prices are more in the East than the West, especially the touristy areas. At alexanderplatz before our bike tour, we spent much more for breakfast. Our friends had breakfast at the hotel yesterday and thought it was good, and the husband laughed and said he didn't recognize he had stayed at the hotel for business until he saw the breakfast room. There are two small cafe/bakeries on the same block, along with a supermarket (open at 8 am) so easy to pick up fruit, yoghurt, bread, coffee etc. as a less expensive breakfast (didn't see eggs though). I walked in the hostel and could see how a previous poster just helped themselves to the included breakfast there (was checking whether we could pay for breakfast but other than 1 euro for taking it out, didn't see such an option). But, ethically, wouldn't recommend having breakfast at the hostel. We asked for a quiet, nonsmoking room and were given one facing the "courtyard" on the eight floor. Our friends room faced the youth hostel and the kids would wave at them from their windows. Although a previous poster said there is no air conditioning--the front desk confirmed there was and there is an individual temperature control in the rooms. The windows do open, but, the temperature is fine in the rooms. We found the rooms to be clean, and got fresh towels each day along with free water. The wireless Internet works just fine--based on previous suggestions, we requested the numbers each evening (one per wireless device). The codes change and are only good for 24 hours. Another poster had noted the bar at the top of the nearby Land'l hotel (across from the tram stop). Our friends checked it out the first night said it was very nice but stuffy. The front desk staff speak good English and were helpful with directions. all in all, would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK to sleep; not a practical location for a tourist visit”
Reviews.Author: zvalim
Reviews.Content: As far as European hotels go, this is a 3.5* hotel. The mattress in our room was very comfortable, which was a great surprise. The reception people were top notch really; great information and attitude. Free wireless internet as well. And the hotel price is decent for a city like Berlin. BUT, given it takes 20+ min to get anywhere central, the location is not a practical one for a tourism visit since you can't get back to the hotel easily in the middle of the day (a *must* in a Berlin summer). In short, although the price and features-per-price are good, I would not recommend this for a Berlin visit. Pay a bit more, and get something central. That's what we'll do next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: sioFont
Reviews.Content: As others said, this hotel is off the beaten track. But I think this is not enough to discard it, because you receive a lot for your money. It says that is a 4-star hotel, but I think is more a 3-star property. But the key factor is that you could have a clean, big (in European terms) room for a low price. What do you sacrifice? Proximity to the city centre. But Alexanderplatz it's just 15 minutes away by tram, so not very far. Room it's clean, although not superclean. As for the maintenance service, I think they could do more. But it's enough. I found the mattress very comfortable and had a good sleep. Room faced a patio, not the street, so I didn't heard noise. Air conditioning worked well, although I didn't really need to use it very much. Windows open, so I could ventilate the room. Bath, in my opinion, need a reform. Shower doors testify a long use. But everything worked fine. Hotel has two levels of wi-fi. A paying one, that is faster and without limits, and a free one (the one I used), with some speed and download limitations. But I managed to make calls with Skype and check emails, so was enough for me. You need to ask for a password every day. A weak element is TV. Maybe you won't spend a lot of time in your room watching TV, but if yes, channel selection is limited and rare. Some channels were not working, and some choices were unexpected (i.e. there is one Spanish channel, but it's a regional one). I didn't have breakfast there neither used the bar. In the morning, I went to the small shopping centre in which the hotel is. It has a bakery, a coffee shop, a kebab restaurant and a supermarket. Opposite the hotel, there is a Burger King. Hotel area is not the best in Berlin, but I didn't feel unsafe. Just went from tram and local rail stop to the hotel and back (1-2 minutes walk). The staff I found at night was very kind. The rate I found makes this hotel an excellent choice for Berlin. Through Park Plaza website you find very good rates. Maybe with a 'name your price' option, you could find a slightly lower rate. So, in brief, I think I did a good choice and I will consider this hotel if I return to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Not quiet a 4 star hotel..”
Reviews.Author: feynman82
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend booked a executive room via hotels.com with two single beds but when we checked in we've been told that this type of room does not even exist. The only type of room with two single beds is a superior room and they were not able to change the booking to that type of room. Room and bathroom were small but clean, the bed was a bit too soft for my taste. Altogether I think that this hotel does not deserve four stars. It feels more like an average 3 star hotel. Also nice was the free (at least for us) directly behind the hotel. Even though the hotel is a bit off, both a tram and a subway station are very close by. Alexanderplatz for example is a ten minute tram ride away from the hotel. Wi-fi was free but very slow on the 5th floor, a guy from 6th floor told us that wi-fi was not working at all there. Bottomline is that I expect more from a four star hotel in terms of room quality and service. But I think I would go there again because of the good location and the great price. I've stayed in hostels in Berlin, which were more expensive and a way worse.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel for nearby conference venue”
Reviews.Author: joe_anne123
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as it was closest to my conference venue, which was the reason for my visit to Berlin. I booked an executive room and was very pleasantly surprised for the price of the room (79 euro pn). The room was a good size, very clean and well appointed with all the usual things you would expect. The bed was really comfy. The bath room – although with just a shower – was absolutely fine and had a hairdryer and magnifying makeup/shaving mirror. There was a kettle and tea/coffee provided too. The staff on reception were helpful on check in. I can't comment on breakfast as our rate didn't include it. We went to the nearby bakery for coffee and pastries each morning (a bargain at around 3 euro). Close by, in the same block, there is a Mexican restaurant and bar (the food was fine but not exciting), a shopping centre with a supermarket and cash machine, a cafe, the aforementioned bakery, etc. The S-bahn station Landsberger Allee is very close which is on the S41/S42 ring. It is fairly easy to get into the more touristy areas of the city with one or two changes. My OH explored Berlin while I was at the conference and found it really easy to get about the city on the S-bahn and U-bahn with a day ticket. Overall, I think it was really good value for a city hotel, and although perhaps a bit out of the way for a tourist, it suited me fine.

Reviews.Title: “A nice enough place, but just too far out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently found this hotel through a discount site. It was a lovely, new building with very friendly staff, ridiculously comfortable beds, and a decent breakfast (not exactly 18 euros worth of breakfast, but it was included with our discount so no harm no foul). Like other reviewers, though, we found this hotel to be too far from the center of activity to justify recommending it to a friend. We still got to see everything we wanted to see, but it would have been nice to be able to pop back into our hotel to freshen up before going on to the next museum. Instead, once we'd made the 10-15 minute tram ride back to the hotel, we were in for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Not on the map”
Reviews.Author: OnyDayToLive
Reviews.Content: Pro's: 1- Very nice for the price 2- Good service 3- Right around the corner is a S-sub,U-sub,tram, and bus hub 4- You can get on the S41 or S42 and go almost anywhere 5- Nice size shopping area on the block Con's:1- Well to summarize it just one. They gave me a tour guide map of the city, how ever the hotel on the map was so far to the right it wasn't on there (that how far out it is) End note: If you don't mind the tram or sub system it not bad. Although most place you tire to get to you'll get on the S or U system anyway

Reviews.Title: “Skip this property - try another Radisson in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Schm00py
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a poor location to the sites and even basic business needs. The rooms are very tired and sparsely appointed. There is nothing outstanding about this hotel. It was inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza No. Park Inn most definately should be rebranded as!!”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here due to flight chaos at Berlin Schonefeld airport as I know the rooms are reasonably cheap (usually 59 Euro a night) plus the hotel is located by Storkower Strasse on the S9 line from the airport and Ring s-bahn. Hotel was a Park Inn in a previous incarnation years back, and to be honest, it should be re-branded as a Park Inn. Not that there is nothing particuartly wrong, but Park Plaza hotels are of a better standard than this one, so Carlson Hotels/Rezidor may want to think about re-branding this one to the mid range Park Inn. Hotel lacks a room safe,tea coffee facilities and an iron/ironing board. It has complimentary wi-fi but this has to be asked for in the form of a voucher from reception. Beds are on the tiny side, two very small singles and noise from the street can be heard from guests returning to the Generator hostel next door. Noise can also be heard from the corridors fromguests returning/leaving so not ideal in terms of sleep quality. Hotel is well situated for the direct s-bahn to the airport, and also the trams which run into Alexanderplatz in about 10 minutes. Not the best, but for a proper Park Plaza experience try the Wallstrasse hotel or the Art'otel Mitte and compare them to this one, you will see what i mean!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. A bit outside the city center. Good customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Wanderfool44
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. $65 + $20 tax per night on priceline.com Good customer service at the front desk (ZERO arrogance. Very down-to-earth and helpful). A bit distant from the city center but with easy public transportation right around the corner. Simple, bare bones, but not at all a cheap-feeling hotel. Just definitely not a 4 star level, as "claimed" on priceline. OK for a weekend with friends if you're trying to save money. Not so great for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Not City Center”
Reviews.Author: kimk76
Reviews.Content: It is conveniently located to public transportation, but it is too far from the city center and isn't that convenient to many of the sites to see in Berlin unless you want to keep hopping on the U or S banh. There are not many restaurants or any kind of nightlife in this area. Next time I'm in Berlin, I'm definitely staying in Mitte. There is free wifi with 24 hour vouchers from the front desk. The connection is slow, but you can purchase a better connection. This hotel seems more suited for business travelers not leisure travelers. The room is standard. I would recommend it to others for the value. The room was for $65 USD per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price but security issues”
Reviews.Author: balmainboy
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel and returned mainly due to our familiararity with the area in regards to transport and eating.The hotel is a straight forward bus then a train ride,It takes around 30mins from the airport.There are stairs from train station up to street level of hotel( no lift). Transport into and around the center of berlin is straight forward and around 15mins via the train or metro tram,which is 50m from hotel which runs well into the early hours.There is a supermarket in complex which has pretty much everything you need. The rooms are nice enough for the 62euro per night we paid and have a little fridge. It was very hot in berlin at this time and our airconditioning in room was not working so they moved us to another room no problem! But the next problem we had is while in our new room we heard someone trying to access the door swipe system.Then before i knew it some stranger with a suitcase was walking into our room, after asking him what he though he was doing he said this is the room he had been given. I called reception and was furious ! What if we had not been there? All our possesions and documents could of been stolen!!!All because they out the wrong room swipe card!!! All they could say is sorry! Well unfortunantly sorry doesnt cut it this time!! Never again

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF - BUT FAR FROM 4 STAR”
Reviews.Author: pag63
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel with 5 friends for a 3 day break in Berlin. I had chosen its location for its easy access to the S-Bahn and tram system. S-Bahn Station is just around the corner, no more than 100m, and the tram stop is at the corner with Landsberger Allee no more than 50m away. It was spot on for location, and all of Berlin`s excellent transport system at our fingertips. So I must give it 10 out of 10 for location. Our rooms - our rooms were not what I had asked for, I had emailed the hotel and requested an upgrade to our rooms (which we had to pay for, of course), but when we arrived this had not been done - even though i had a hard-copy of their email which informed me that they had the suite rooms available and reserved for us, a glitch which i was not happy about. We were given rooms on the second floor, which were clean and tidy - but rank of cigarette smoke, and thank goodness we did not spend much time in the rooms. However the beds were comfortable, but the street is very noisey from around 6am onwards, we are early risers - which was just as well. We did not use any of the hotel facilities, the 12 Euro breakfast we felt was much to expensive - we got a very nice 4 Euro one in a cafe around the corner near the train station. We did not use the bar very much - I think only one night for 2 drinks, but it was not that expensive - and pleasant. There is a hotel across the Landsberger Allee on the other corner, we used their bar on the 14th floor - a super location, fine views over Berlin and really plush surroundings, good beer and free nuts with every round - but if you give the waitress a tip, every body gets loads of nuts! In all things you get exactly what you pay for - we got a 2 star hotel, for a 2 star price. If they wish to call themselves a 4 Star Hotel then that`s fine (but wishfull thinking on their part) We did not see anything remotely like a 4 Star Hotel - but what we did see was OK, and if you are on a budget with a few mates and would rather spend your euros on beer and food - than accomodation - then this hotel is for you. Upon returning home, I noticed that my credit card had been charged an additional 400 Euros, when i contacted my card company they informed me that this was normal for this chain and that it would drop off my account in a few days - which it did, but I was nonetheless less than chuffed with this ability to charge my account with whatever they liked without my consent. AND FINALLY - IF YOU CAN`T HOLD YOUR DRINK, AND NEED TO SLEEP ON IN THE MORNING, AND YOU MAY SUFFER THE EFFECTS OF COPIOUS BEERS - THEN SEEK SOME PLACE QUIETER.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in a heat wave!”
Reviews.Author: LucyFM
Reviews.Content: OK. Let's start with the positives. This hotel is amazing value for money. I think we paid 49Euros per room per night. The room was clean and a good size. The staff were friendly. Free Wifi. It is really close to the SBahn station and if you are prepared to walk a bit it is convenient for Prenzlauer Berg. But, from my limited understanding of Berlin geography to say that it is in Prenzlauer Berg is a bit of an exaggeration. However, the area is not very interesting (a rather bizzare Mexican Restaurant nextdoor) and you really do need to travel to find cafes, museums, bars and shops. It is not the standard I am used to from a Park Plaza to be honest. I could be wrong but it looks as if it has been converted from another hotel chain. The biggest problem with the hotel was the temperature. I cannot find the words to explain how hot it was. My friend and I were 'upgraded' to exective rooms on the top floor of the hotel(this means free bottles of mineral water and mouthwash - apart from that there is no difference to rooms on lower floors). How do I know this? Well heat rises and I have never been in a hotel room that is so hot. There was a fan but it did nothing. The room was unbearable. I asked to move (they added me to a rather long list). I was moved to the third floor which was marginally better. If you want a great value hotel and the weather is cool then I would recommend it......... if you want to be in the action and cool the don't!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: th3pu7p
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed this hotel in Berlin for three nights in May 2010 and she got a very good B&B deal from a travel agent in Holland. The breakfast was an excellent buffet and there was plenty of things to choose from! The staff were very helpful and friendly offering advice and answered any questions we had. The location is reasonably central; the tram line is situated about 2minutes walk from the hotel (which takes you straight to the centre within 10minutes) and the train line is about 4minutes walk from the hotel which you can use to get anywhere (including Schoenefeld airport without changes). The rooms were very clean but simple and although the hotel is on a pretty busy road you cannot hear any of the traffic. There is a very cheap (and decent) Italian resturant right around the corner of the hotel and a couple bakeries right by if you want lunch. I agree with what others have written. If you are looking for a base from which to explore Berlin and you do not intend spending much time in the hotel, then it is a good value for money choice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Monteiro2148
Reviews.Content: We were so happy that this hotel was extremely clean and accomidating. The staff at the hotel front desk are just wonderful. They are always willing to help you with the biggest smiles ever. Perfect location..very close walking distance to the tram,. I will reccomend this hotel to any and everyone who is headed to Berlin. We would like to say that the Park Plaza Hotel is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicki071
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long-weekend break in Berlin with a mate. It was decent enough; clean, safe, easy to find and only 2mins walk from the S-Bhan, (with a direct line running straight to Schonefeld airport- circa 30mins journey time). The staff were great - very helpful and friendly. The rooms and beds are not luxurious. Our room faced onto the busy street below and the noise of traffic really was quite bad, so try to ask for a room on the quieter side. There were not many eating places within walking distance, but the S and U-Bhan services are so easy to use that exploring eateries nearby was half the fun. If you are looking for a base from which to explore Berlin and you don't intened spending much time in the hotel, then it is a good value for money choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great value”
Reviews.Author: Chafic
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with my stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly and they upgraded our room since we asked for the quieter side of the hotel at no extra charge! The hotel is very close to the subway but you could not hear the trains from our room. We didn't try our the restaurant because there were so many inexpensive restaurants just around the corner. Wi-fi was available but at an expensive cost. The Mexican restaurant next door had free wi-fi however ;) I would recommend this hotel to a friend visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel near to city”
Reviews.Author: olivermankowski
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, pleasant staff in safe area, especially for east Berlin. Good tram link, at £50/night, very reasonable for location. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay but far off down town”
Reviews.Author: PierreC1
Reviews.Content: If this is your first visit in Berlin i suggest you dont pick this hotel. First, its far from downtown, second the people around the hotel looked so depressed, not very good with the english and there is absolutely not decent restaurant or else around that hotel. The front desk people were nice and helpful, the food of the restaurant was decent although there was not much action around that restaurant at night, i stayed there 4 nights and didnt see anyone eating there beside me. The room was decently clean, Mine has a huge dry stain right in front of my bed, i had to report that one. Beside that the room was ok. My view was the back alley of the hotel...not glamorous. Overall a decent price, decent place but i cant recommand this one if you want to visit Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: iam5tv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked with the Top Secret service on Lastminute.com. It was an excellent price (3 nights and 2x BA flights from LHR to TXL for £430). It was about 15 minutes on the tram into Alexanderplatz which was fine, and about €12 in a taxi back from Friedrichstrasse. The taxi from Tegel was about €25. The decor in the hotel was a bit old, and the facilities were minimal, even after we upgraded the room (only €20 more per night!) It was a great price, but a bit far away. I would rather stay somewhere closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but far from the sights”
Reviews.Author: Exchangers
Reviews.Content: The staff at his hotel were quite helpful and nice. The rooms were adequate but it was a decent value. The main concern was its location. It was quite far from many of the sights so if you were staying for a short amount of time I wouldn't recommend it. There were a couple of good fast food eateries close by that had great food at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertHanley
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with great access to city centre and airport. On a busy road but still quiet enough for a good nights sleep. Hotel rooms were immaculately clean, spacious and offered a minibar at decent prices. Only reservation would be that the windows opened fully no matter what floor you are on and if you have small children it could prove a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: TapestryCrochet
Reviews.Content: We reserved 4 nights on [--], having been routed from a web page that promised free breakfast and free wireless lobby internet. The internet was fine, but no free breakfast (it cost 12 Euros per person). I reported the broken air conditioner right away (the fan just recirculated the stuffy air) but all they did was open the window (which cooled the air, but increased the street noise). Although the room was large for European standards and the hotel was conveniently located next to the Landsberger train station, I chose it over another because of the free breakfast. When contacted, Priceline said that they had no control over the promised amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK - Depends what you pay though..”
Reviews.Author: KilosUk
Reviews.Content: Most people have covered everything thats bad and good about this place, its not a great location or the prettiest part of town, however being right on the doorstep of the train/tram route negates that problem - We got taxis back at night and seemed to pay around 15 euros to most places we visited in an around the centre. In terms of the hotel itself the staff are really helpful, the rooms are functional, if not exactly upto date and twin beds were quite small. Bathroom was small and the shower in the bath wasnt great for anyone over 4ft, the towels were small (and a bit ageing for my liking). Considering we were in the superior room on the business floor aswell. The standard rooms seemed exactly the same except smaller. There is a nice modern bar area / reception and the food was ok. We paid 100 euros a night - for which i would have expected a reasonable 4 star hotel and full in-house amenities. However a friend of ours only paid 56, which seems to tie in what others have mentioned here and at 56 euros this a good place to stay if you dont mind using the trams / taxis to get around - At 100 without breakfast, i was slightly underwhelmed, for me it was a good 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good base”
Reviews.Author: nub1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Plaza for a three night trip to Berlin. Very impressed by how close it was to a U-Bahn/S-Bahn station; literally 30 seconds away is Landsberger Allee station which serves the lines which take you into town. It is quite far away from the main hustle and bustle of Berlin - I'd say about a 20/25 minute tube ride - but it's all very straightforward to find which lines you need and where to change. DON'T get the tube to Storkower Strasse; go to Landsberger Allee instead. Storkower Strasse station is a huge trek from the hotel! The hotel itself was fairly basic, but very clean, well maintained and demonstrative of great service. Our beds were turned down daily and rooms tidied, and we weren't bothered by housekeeping at all...the maids were invisible, yet our room was kept immaculate. Towels were changed on request, and I THINK we got new sheets at least once. The bed was GREAT; a HUGE double that was really comfortable. We didn't do the breakfast buffet at all, though I sort of wished we did. They issued tokens, apparently due to our booking with a particular travel website, that allowed us to have the buffet for 8 euros rather than the standard 12, but we didn't use it as we'd often snack on Wurst at about 11am instead! Didn't use the hotel bar either. Our room really was just a base! The reception staff were excellent and helpful. I tried out my terrible, hotch-potch German and they humoured me...and then when the inevitable happened and they asked something I didn't understand, they repeated the request in perfect English. They also seemed to remember us throughout our stay, automatically speaking English whenever they saw us. The only negative thing was that I think our TV didn't work properly. It promised BBC on one of the channels, but we got only static. Also, teletext didn't work and neither did the messaging system, or the TV info. Whilst flicking through the channels we got the shock of our life when confronted with, well...a rather sizeable piece of man-equipment thrusting across the screen, to find that the Pay Per View porn was activated of its own accord!! We hastily switched over and consulted the guide in the room, which told us that if we wanted Pay Per View we had to go through a series of pressing buttons, confirming payment etc, which we certainly hadn't done. We tried pressing all the colour buttons to see what they'd do, and just got an error message...confirming, at least to our minds, that the TV was indeed not working properly. We were all ready to defend ourselves in reception if they tried to charge us for three days' worth of televisiual romping, but they didn't mention it. I'd therefore advise guests to exercise caution when allowing kiddywinks to flick through the TV! All in all, great service, good location and a clean, nice room.

Reviews.Title: “4 star + service, great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: dbldutchtreat
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about the service we received at the Park Plaza during our recent trip. the location was perfect for our stay as it was an easy walk to the pool (we were there for swimming champs) and everything we needed for our long weekend. The rooms are a standard (American class) hotel room. It seems new or recently renovated. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Now for the best - the service. When we wanted to go to a pancake house the reception searched until they found one (though next time I'd ask for crepes). When I needed an electrical adapter I didn't need to go out and buy one because the hotel had one they loaned me for the entire stay. When my daughter was sick, the hotel arranged for a pediatrician to come to our room within a couple of hours (fully equipped, able to do strep test there, about same price as normal US doctor visit). They helped with our train tickets for departure, searched for the charger I lost, were always smiling and friendly. I can not believe the outstanding service and the incredible value for money as we paid between 50 to 80 Euros/night!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but great service!”
Reviews.Author: KindredNZUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the weekend of this year's Berlin Marathon. It was our first visit to Berlin and good hotels were hard to come by! This hotel had brilliant service and a very nice bar and restaurant on the ground floor. We thought that our bedroom was a little sub-par - definitely more three star than four star - and the air conditioning left a lot to be desired: our room was really stuffy. I wouldn't book this hotel for a romantic weekend away or anything, but as a base for exploring the city it would be fantastic - it's a couple of minutes' walk to the train (and Berlin's public transport is wonderful). Some reviews have slated the hotel breakfasts, but we found it to be absolutely fine! It was also great that the hotel staff obviously anticipated that a lot of their guests were in town to run the marathon - they had a big pasta buffet for dinner the night before, for example.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: hmp_825
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Plaza Berlin for 3 nights 7-10 April with my friend and was a little concerned about the location as it seemed to be a little out of the way, but it was a bus followed by an S-Bahn ride from the airport and both ran every ten minutes and took 25 minutes to get to the hotel. We got a 21.50 euro card that lasted 72 hours and included huge discounts off most attraction and souvenior shops. The transport system in Berlin is fantastic and the tram runs through the night and with a tram stop right outside the hotel this was really an excellent place to stay location wise. The S-Bahn also run right outside the hotel - the station is Landsberger Allee, not Stockower like i originally thought! The room are reasonably sized, but that isn't an issue for me anyway and its clean and modern decor. The view isn't very inspiring, but we didn't spend much time in the room! I would say that the one pillow made it hard to sleep as they were so thin, but the reception provided us with more. Our flight home wasn't until the evening, but when we checked out they stored our luggage and were very accommating. All in all a great stay...it was very cold in Berlin, particularly on the day we decided to go on the FREE tour round Berlin so dress up with gloves and scarf etc. The free tour is superb (they work for tips) and was the highlight of the trip as was the pub crawl!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddmelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel in May 2007 with tour group. The staff were very helpful. Bought transport ticket at front desk. Young guy on desk only to happy to give transport info and map. Tram across the road, as is train station. 10 minutes from Alexanderplatz. Plenty of places to eat near by. Had italian one night [ family run]and chinese another, both very reasonable. We were lucky to have a large corner suite {2 rooms} It was very clean and not too noisy even though it was overlooking the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cb83UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 2 night break to Berlin. Lovely clean an dwell maintained hotel. Very close to the tram station and set in a small shopping arcade. Lovely restaurant and bar in the hotel and also a nice Bulgarian restaurant 2 doors away. staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected but far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: The hotel, located in former East Berlin, is new, nice, clean and an excellent value for the money. It is also very close to, and well connected by public transportation to everywhere in Berlin including Schoenefeld airport. It is however not near to city centre: you would need to change at least two lines on the S-Bahn/U-bahn network or take a tram. Both rides take 25-30 minutes. Taxi may be faster depending on traffic but a ride to "Mitte" would be no less than 10 Euros making this quite unconvenient. Moreover, taxies are not readily available outside of the hotel: you may have to wait for some time to have one called by the very polite and efficient staff at peak hours or in bad weather. In the end, the hotel is a best choice if you use it only to sleep and get changed, or if you do not mind about commuting time between major attractions in Berlin and your room. If you wish to stay where action takes place you might think of treating yourself at a more centrally located option.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: AusTraveller2007
Reviews.Content: The staff here were fantastic, the room was more than comfortable, the breakfast was lovely, and a lovely breakfast room, and the hotel restaurant was exceptional!!! Very clean, a really nice stay! Can't say anything bad about our time at Park Plaza Prenzlauer Berg Berlin. Fantastic location with the tram right outside the door, and close to main train line.

Reviews.Title: “Weary Traveller Found Rest”
Reviews.Author: LevRaphael
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin at the end of a two-week book tour sponsored by my German publisher for my book "Yiddishkeit: oder das eigene Leben" ("Secret Anniversaries of the Heart" in the original English version) and wanted to be comfortable. It was hard getting someplace for the May 1 holiday weekend, and this was one of the few choices. I had an executive room with good minibar and soaking tub in the small bathroom. Having traveled extensively in Europe, I find a soaking tub a true luxury, even if it's not a "luxus" hotel. The side facing Storkowerstrasse is quieter than the other and I was at the end of the hallway and far away from the elevator. There's golden oldie music in the hallways and elevator that you can't hear inside your room. Sometimes it annoyed me, but often I found the 80s tunes a hilarious trip back in time. The room was cheerful and hip and I enjoyed my stay. I didn't realize right away that the arrow controls by the door were for the exterior light-damping window shades, so learn from my ignorance! :-). I've stayed elsewhere in Berlin and though this is not a scenic part of the city per se (though elsewhere in Prenzlauer Berg is hip and lovely), you get a feel for the old East Berlin which i find very suggestive, stimulating and intriguing as a writer. And the trips I made from there to Kreuzberg and back were really fascinating. The hotel food was good, though breakfast merely average. Staff was helpful whether I spoke German or English, though perhaps somewhat more so with the former. Cabs come amazingly quickly when called by the front desk. A special treat: a few doors down is a Bulgarian restaurant. Good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “...so and so...”
Reviews.Author: Μαρία_
Reviews.Content: We booked the room (average 80euro without breakfast) one week before travelling. They were very helpful in booking the room and sending me information about to reach the hotel from the airport. The hotel is in a good, quiet district. You have to take more than 1 metro to go to the center of Berlin. Otherwise, you take the tram that is in front of the hotel, arrive at central Alexanderplatz and then take another train. The first day that we arrived, we decided to go for breakfast in the hotel. The breakfast was below average (costs 10euro per person) and it didn't include any german sweets and other local food. The other 2 days, we bought coffee, sandwiches and sweets from a local shop near the hotel. Perfect quality, quite cheap. The room (second floor) was neither small nor big. We had problems with the heat, it was always cold. Even when we tried to increase the heat, it didn't work. Another problem were the pillows, too small. We asked for 2 extra and the receptionist sent us very quickly. Concluding, I was not totally satisfied with the hotel. If I had paied only 40euro per day, I would be happy. In a total of 250euro for 3days stay, you expect more. I advise to check it before booking. Make sure that the heat is OK in the room. Have a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: rich.hull
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and felt it had been an excellent choice. OK, the immeadiate surroundings are not the most scenic, unless you have a strong interest in tower blocks, but there's a tram stop and an S Bahn station within 2 minutes walk. Getting there from Schonefeld was easy - we took the S9 train to Treptower Park, then changed onto the S42 for 3 stops. (Tip - you can get the S9 to Ostkreuz but there you have a long walk to the S42 platform. At Treptower the platforms are adjacent.) Our room was large, comfortable and well furnished, but what would hotel designers do without pale lemon paint and beech furniture? The bathroom was small by comparison but very well set out to make the best use of space. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel (available for 10 Euros), but being cheapskates took a kettle and made use of the Kamps bakery in the shopping centre next door - ace pastry selection! By the way, the Lidl supermarket others have mentioned has now closed, but die hard fans need only hop on the SBahn for 2 stops to Prenzlauer Allee. Prenzlauer Berg is excellent for bars and restaurants - we particularly liked 'Frida Kahlo' and 'Endlos' - but if you want to stay local without using the hotel restaurant, the shopping centre has options. There's an Italian restaurant, or for something a bit different, a Bulgarian. Also, there's a 24 hour Kebab place, which we used before heading back to the airport - 4 kebabs, 4 drinks and attempted conversation with locals all for 14 Euros. Overall, we were really pleased with the hotel. We didn't have much contact with the staff but when we did, found them efficient and helpful. They all speak good English and were polite enough not to cricicise my German. We would certainly consider staying here again on our next visit to Berlin. PS - many booking websites offer this hotel for 64 Euros (room only), but we booked via Worldres.com and got a discount rate of 54. That's a bargain....

Reviews.Title: “New but smal rooms”
Reviews.Author: dottorsocrates
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February, for business. The hotel is brand new, clean, in one of the main squares of Berlin next to the TV tower. Not tested the restaurant. Only problem i faced is that the room was very small. At the top of the hotel there is a casino, but you must ear a jacket and no jeans are allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fizzler
Reviews.Content: Although a short journey outside of the city centre, this hotel makes a good base for people on a city break. As one of the other reviewers has said, it is in the east of the city, so is in amongst run-down blocks of flats and the views aren't very inspiring! But, don't be put off. It's very near to a train station and a tram stop, and a taxi journey to the Brandenburg Gate only costs around £8 (ask the receptionist to call a taxi for you). Make sure you write down the address of the hotel though, to show taxi drivers when you want to return to it, as there are TWO Park Plaza Hotels in Berlin (the other is the Park Plaza Wallstreet). On the whole we found the staff very efficient, but the levels of friendliness ranged from extremely friendly to not at all friendly! However, all of the staff spoke good English and were able to give us information on local events - we were there for the Berlin Marathon, and the staff were able to advise us about road blocks etc. The hotel was not totally what I was expecting - on its website, the communal areas sound much larger than they are! In reality, the "bar" is a tiny extension of the reception desk, and there are 3 or 4 tables with chairs round, then that's it (apart from the restaurant, which is rather canteen like). So, don't pick this hotel if you want to sit around in the lounge and meet up with friends etc. There is, however, a small cafe/restaurant next door, a supermarket just up the road (for water and snacks) and a kebab shop and internet cafe around the corner. Our room was large and spotlessly clean, with a really nice bathroom, and was very comfortable. Our room rate did not include breakfast though, so we had to pay around £8 extra (each). We did this on the first day, but then for the remainder of our stay we went to the supermarket and bought fruit and bread etc instead - much cheaper! Our room was equipped with a kettle - first time ever I've seen one, in a continental hotel! There's also a fridge (containing the mini bar) that you can buy milk and then keep in there. Oh, one more thing - on our arrival, there was a little packet of Harribo on our pillows! A nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LouiseGlos
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel. We stayed in September 2006. Staff were friendly and helpful, and all spoke fluent english. Although a little outside the centre of Berlin (about 20 mins to the centre) the public transport system is excellent. Frequent trains from the Landsberger Allee station (2 minutes walk from the hotel). Whilst the restaurant menu was quite basic the food was of a good quality and the service was good. The hotel rooms are a good size, modern and very clean. The bathroom had a full bath/shower setup and was again very clean (and kept that way during our four day visit). There was a mini-bar in the room although we didn't use it. There is a small shopping centre just around the corner from the hotel (near the S-bahn station) which contains a Lidl supermarket, hairdresser, restaurant and internet cafe (useful if you don't have a laptop!). The only downsides were the view from the hotel (flats and roads) and the noise from the busy road during the day. However, the noise quickly died down at night and the soundproofing within the hotel itself is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: fredmeadows
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. Although a tram ride outside berlin city centre for the price this is a great little hotel.The staff are young and incredibly helpful and knowledgable about what to see and do and transport. The rooms are small but clean and warm. The bar is tiny but not at all pricey. The restaurant is underused with a small menu but the food is tasty and well cooked. The tram into berlin city stops just outside the hotel and takes 10-15 mins and they run frequently and on time. I would recommend travellers getting a travel pass at the airport and take the excellent airport express train into the city. All in all a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Good, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights in this hotel. We did arrive a few hours before official check in time, so hotel did not have a non smoking standard room available at that time, but we were instead offered an executive room for an extra 5 euros per night, which was still very cheap. The room was very nice, bed was so comfortable that we didn't want to get up. View wasn't fantastic, but we literally only used the room for sleeping, so this did not matter much to us. Only had breakfast once at the hotel for 10euros per person. The usual- cereals, yoghurts, scrambled egg, meatballs, etc. Very nice. Staff were also friendly, but were once given an evil look by a receptionist (who was on the phone) when we came out of the lift chatting... The location was extremely good for transport, the s-bahn and tram stop just around the corner from the hotel (you need the 'Landsberger Allee' s-bahn stop, not 'Storkower St' ; if you're taking tram it's the the same again, and not 'peterberg st/landsberger allee') There wasn't much going on at all by the hotel itself, so we felt like we had to stay out the whole day, since it wasn't worth popping back to the hotel in the middle of the day cos there was nothing to do in that area. Overall a very good hotel, just not close to anything of interest. Be prepared to travel. If we hadn't been in such a hurry, and done more research,we would have chosen something more central because when we got back in the evenings, the area by the hotel was very quiet, quite eerie, no people around. 5.80 euros for a day ticket (use this on S & U-bahn and the trams aswell). Good value for money. A 2 hour ticket is 2.10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Surprise in Berlin.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great surprise!! The Staff was very friendly and helpful with helping us figure our way around town. The rooms were very spacious and very nice. The hotel is on the east side of Berlin but very close to the U-bahn and tram station!! The only down side is we wished the hotel was a bit closer to the sights but it is only a 15-20 min ride on the transit system. The breakfast was mostly cold items-cheeses, meats, yogurt, etc. but it was nice :) I highly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Big room, good breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kelvrp
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here for seven nights (part business, part pleasure) and was very pleased. I had a huge room (called a business suite); very clean and RadissonSAS-esque furniture and decor. The hotel is located right by Landsberger Allee S-bahn station (on the ring lines) and the tram stop (same name) is served by three high frequency Metrotram routes into the city centre. It takes aboiut 10 minutes into Alexanderplatz. There was a good buffet breakfast at €10; the minbar prices were on a par with most hotels (eg beer €2.50). The only downside was that every night there was a coach party staying so I needed to choose breakfast times to avoid them as they all went in together. The staff were all friendly and helpful and very willing to speak in English to any non-German speakers. All in all a very pleasing experience and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Nev05
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's self is quite modern but we had no idea that it was so far away from the centre and tourist areas of Berlin. Also we were quite surprised to find that there is still such a big divide between East and West Berlin. The Park Plaza Hotel is in East Berlin and the area consists mainly of large derelict buildings, graffiti clad walls and couple of small shops. Our only escape from this was by the wonderful transport system in Berlin, which you should try, as taxis are quite expensive. The staff in the hotel, although pleasant (but rarely smiling) , were unable to speak good English and were unable to give us directions and explain local stuff to us. We found that the bar facilities in the hotel were non-existent and the restaurant menu remained the same for the entire duration of our stay, and to be honest, it didn't inspire us to eat there. The rooms were a good size and clean but the views left an awful lot to be desired and the mini bar was truly over priced as it is in most hotels. It was an experience one which I don't think I'd be too keen to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Visit October 2003”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Plaza Hotel Berlin during my October 2003 visit.Rooms were very spacious and clean.Rooms were very well sound proofed.They had a mini bar and nicely appointed marble bathrooms.Would definetly stay here again especially for the money and quality of service.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Plaza Prenzlauer Berg Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Storkower Strasse 162, 10407 Berlin, Germany
